H0.text: The soil absorbs sunlight to bring nutrients necessary for plant growth into the soil.

H1.text: Water filters through the soil is how the nutrients necessary for plant growth get into the soil.

H2.text: Organic matter is decayed in the soil to release the nutrients necessary for plant growth.

H3.text: The soil is exposed to air is the way the nutrients necessary for plant growth get into the soil.

A4.text: Organic matter is common throughout the ecosystem and is cycled through decomposition processes by soil microbial communities that are crucial for nutrient availability.

A5.text: Organic matter provides nutrition to living organisms.
